name: Hypertext Transfer Protocol
summary: An application layer protocol for distributed, collaborative, hypermedia information systems. It is the foundation of data communication for the World Wide Web.
purpose: Enable the fetching of resources (HTML, images, scripts, etc.) over the web in a client-server model

handshake.description: HTTP is stateless and does not require a handshake for communication. Clients send requests and servers respond.

fields.name: Request Line / Status Line
fields.description: Request Line for clients: METHOD URL HTTP/VERSION; Status Line for servers: HTTP/VERSION STATUS_CODE REASON_PHRASE

fields.name: Headers
fields.description: Key-value pairs that provide metadata about the request or response

fields.name: Body
fields.description: Payload of the request or response, may be empty for some methods

pitfalls: Stateless: no built-in session handling (requires cookies or tokens)
Data transmitted in plain text unless layered with TLS
No built-in reliability beyond underlying transport (TCP)
